Body:
Are there languages whose plural pronouns ('we', 'they', etc.) are formed from singular pronouns ('I', 'he', etc.) plus a plural marker?

For example, if English were such a language, instead of "we" we would say "Is" (the pronoun 'I' + the plural suffix -s), "hes" to mean "they", etc.
Title: Do any languages form plural pronouns by adding a suffix to the singular form?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
